TopicTitle: [WIP] Talisar Aerospace - Current project Large Upper Stage coop with Chaka Monkey ES

Articles.Content:
Welcome to my all new WIP thread. I'm hoping that posting my projects here will enable me to find what ideas I have that people are interested in as well as help me focus on those projects so I can bring them to completion.

My current project is inspired by the Large Upper Stage for the Boeing Space Launch System in cooperation with YANFRET from Chaka Monkey Exploration Systems (who brought this idea to my attention and will be using his considerable texturing skills to bring this project to fruition)

This is what we will be endeavoring to reproduce:

Basic modelling has been completed, and we're down to modelling the equipment shelf and fine details, then it's off for texturing:

Please let us know what you think. Questions and suggestions are always welcome!

Yep SO unless we make a bespoke shroud then we would standardize it to the KW Decoupler Shroud. What ever size you're using, as long as the shroud is scaled with it you're all set. The plan at this time is to have a lower attach point below the engines which will fix it to the lower stage shroud. That way the engines are hanging from the tanks and not part of the structural path, making it easy to change the upper stage engine config without a major redesign of your launch vehicle.

In this picture you can see where the 6.3 Meters Kerbol (0.75 x 8.4 meter) version will go in the Chaka Monkey heavy lift system

So naturally there is a .75 scale 8.4 meter (6.3 Meters Kerbol) decoupler shroud (KW) from the bottom of the upper tank to the lower stage.

Just a small update on the modelling progress here. This one includes the equipment basket where the engines would be mounted

You should make a version of the single engine model seen in the Orion pic that is compatible with Sumghai's SDHI Orion-like service module. It would make for some seriously awesome Duna missions (I think this can be done by scaling down your existing parts by a factof of 0.667).

It's going to be set up so engines would be added separately. We're going to have a centerline mounting node, as well as the 4 other mounting nodes. This way you can set it up using either the single, dual, or quad engine configuration.

-edit- I'm also modelling the part so it will scale easily from the more true-to-life size down to Kerbal standards. The scaled down version will have a 3.75m upper tank and 2.5m lower.
